result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul C Malone

records.addlTxt: At defendant's request bond modified to no violent or disorderly contact.
No consumption of alcohol and no violent or disorderly contact with Amanda Daniels.

11:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul C Malone in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jon Padgham in court for Paul C Malone. State - here for PH but believe it is being waived. Padgham and Malone agree. Court has waiver of right t PH, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State has filed the Information. Padgham has Information, will waive reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond. Padgham now wants to be heard on bond - asks that the condition of no contact with Amanda Daniels to no violent contact with victim for stated reasons. State - no form filed for that, informs parties of that procedure. Court will continue bond at this point, again instruct parties how to get the no contact provision dropped, set for JT, if resolved - contact JA for PLEAS. Court will modify bond to no consumption of alcohol and no violent or disorderly contact with Amanda Daniels.
and Certificate of Appearance - JJ
No consumption of alcohol and no contact with Amanda Daniels.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul C Malone appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Jon Padgham in court for Paul C Malone. Malone and Padgham has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH, would like to be heard on bond prior to making the decision to waive the time limits. Padgham - bond - asks Court to reduce bond to $1,000.00 cash and if necessary, a signature bond also, also makes reference to his open Shawano County case and the need for him to receive his recently prescribed medication while in custody. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - curious about how the FOSO cannot give prescribed mediations to the inmates - State is willing to look into that. Court - bond on 22CF52 - modifies bond to $1,000.00 cash with same conditions of no consumption of alcohol and no contact with Amanda Daniels. Padgham will waive time limits for PH now. Court sets for PH on 6/23/22 at 11:00 AM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul C Malone appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody. Court reviews file, still no attorney from SPD as of 5/17/22, keep in contact with them, continues bond, set for AIA om 6/15/22 at 9:45 AM. Malone mentions a bond reduction, can possibly post $200.00. State - bond - objects to bond reduction at this point. Court - bond - needs more cash than $200.00, continues bond at this point, let Court know if he can come up with more money.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul C Malone appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody and appears from FOSO. Court reviews file, no attorney from SPD yet, continues bond. Defendant stays in constant contact with them. Court reviews file further as it relates to bond and a possible reduction. Defendant thinks he can possibly come up with $1000.00 to post for bond. Court will review at next hearing, keep contacting SPD, continues bond at this point, sets for AIA on 6/1/22 at 10:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:26 AM Defendant Paul C Malone in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul C Malone appeared by video means. Court reviews file, SPD still does not have counsel for the defendant, continues bond, set for AIA on 5/18/22 at 9:30 AM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
SPD Status of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:56 AM Defendant Paul C Malone in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul C Malone appeared by video means from FOSO. Court reviews file, SPD still does not have counsel for him, keep in constant contact with them. Malone understands, asks for bond reduction in half. State - bond - asks for bond to continue for stated reasons. Malone makes statement for bond reduction - trying to get into treatment, can possibly post $2,000.00 cash. Court - bond - continues bond at this point for stated reasons, sets for AIA on 4/27/22 at 9:15 AM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
SPD Status of Counsel Report
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Paul C Malone in court, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul C Malone appeared by video means from FOSO. Court reviews file, no attorney from SPD yet, keep in constant contact with them, sets for another AIA on 4/20/22 at 10:00 AM. Malone asks to visit bond. State - objects to any bond reduction for stated reasons. Court asks for defendant's criminal history. State responds. Court continues bond for stated reasons. Defendant asks if Court will change its mind as it relates to bond if he gets on Vivatrol. Court responds.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

records.addlTxt: Order for Withdrawal of Counsel
records.descr: Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 13, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:08 AM Defendant Paul C Malone in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Paul C Malone in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul C Malone appeared by video means with Attorney. Halyburton states that she now has a conflict on this matter after reviewing the complaint, has discussed this with the defendant and will be withdrawing from this case and his other open matter. Court will sign the order for this matter, other case is Judge Kussel. Court will continues bond, sets foor AIA on 4/13/22 at 10:15 AM. Malone asks to be heard on bond. Court will allow an argument. Malone asks for lower and to be put on the Vivatrol Program. State - bond - objects to bond reduction for stated reasons. Court continues bond at this point, can address again at the ARGN.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Paul C Malone in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Defendant Paul C Malone in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Paul C Malone appeared by video means with Attorney. Halyburton does have complaint but has not gone over it with her client. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Halyburton and Malone understand charges and penalties. Court confirms address and phone number, states he has no phone and is currently homeless if released.  Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 3/30/22 at 10:00 AM. Malone asks for bond reduction. Court has concerns that he has no address, no job, no phone. Malone responds, can live with his mother, would like Court to make a bond condition to take Vivatrol. Malone asks for no more than $1,000.00 cash bond. State objects to any modifications of bond for stated reasons. Malone makes statement in regard to the escape charge, states he has never escaped from jail. Court informs him to talk to his lawyer in regard to that. Court continues bond.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with A.D.
cash
